comments:
After successfully launching a couple of times, I now get the following
exception followed by a dialog telling me to consult the log, followed by nothing.

java.lang.ClassCastException
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.PackageAdmin.getExportedBundles(PackageAdmin.java:116)
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.PackageAdmin.initialize(PackageAdmin.java:78)
	at
org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework.initialize(Framework.java:200)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.Framework.<init>(Framework.java:97)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.OSGi.createFramework(OSGi.java:90)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.internal.core.OSGi.<init>(OSGi.java:31)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:86)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:279)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:742)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:581)

Deleting the .config folder made M7 launch again. (I also tried renaming the
workspace folder prior to re-launching.) The problem appears to be in the
.config folder.

did you change your configuration at all by manually messing 
with/adding/removing any plugins?  If so, please detail.  Something must have 
changed in there as under normal circumstances, the contents of the config area 
do not change unless some other change is detected.

We'll wait for more info.  Note also that this may well be an Update thing 
rather than Equinox.

I didn't add any plugins between the last time it launched and the first time it
failed to launch. IIRC, I launched once with no extra plugins. Exited and added
my plugin (XMLBuddy Pro) to the plugins folder. Relaunched, confirmed that the
plugin still seemed to work in M7. Then, perhaps on the next try, launch failed
as indicated.

I added a fix to the PackageAdmin code to prevent such a ClassCastException 
from occurring.  The problem could occur if a fragment bundle's host changes 
due to adding/removing/updating the installed plugins.

This situation seemed to have occurred because the state returned a fragment 
BundleDescription from getResolvedBundles() that either did not have its 
HostSpecification set or its HostSpecification did not have its supplier set.  
In either case I would not expect the state to return such a BundleDescription 
for a resolved fragment.
*** Bug 51553 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
moving to Tom for further investigation or closure.
A Fix has been dropped for this a while back and should be fixed in M8.
